sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ Introduction
content: In JavaScript, reference data types are used to store collections of data or more complex entities. Unlike primitive types, they are mutable and are accessed by reference.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ Object
content: Objects are collections of key-value pairs. They can store multiple values and are widely used in JavaScript.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ Array
content: Arrays are list-like objects used to store multiple values in a single variable.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ Function
content: Functions in JavaScript are first-class objects, meaning they can be stored in variables, passed as arguments, and returned from other functions.

sections.heading: ðŸ”¹ Date
content: The Date object is used to work with dates and times in JavaScript.
